Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox

Interface Mailbox

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MaildirMailbox, MboxMailbox
    public interface Mailbox
    Interface for accessing mailbox contents. Implementations of this interface provide access to a single mailbox (folder) from various backend storage systems.

    This interface is designed to be shared across multiple mail access protocols including POP3 and IMAP.

    All implementations must be thread-safe as a single mailbox may be accessed by multiple concurrent sessions.

    This interface uses NIO ReadableByteChannel for message content access, consistent with Gumdrop's NIO architecture.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close​(boolean expunge)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the mailbox and releases any locks. This should commit any pending deletions.
        Parameters:
        expunge - if true, permanently remove messages marked for deletion; if false, unmark all deletion marks
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the mailbox cannot be closed properly

      • getName

        default java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this mailbox. For POP3, this is typically "INBOX".
        Returns:
        the mailbox name

      • isReadOnly

        default boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns whether this mailbox is open in read-only mode.
        Returns:
        true if read-only

      • getMessageCount

        int getMessageCount()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the number of messages in the mailbox. This does not include messages marked for deletion.
        Returns:
        the number of accessible messages
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the count cannot be determined

      • getMailboxSize

        long getMailboxSize()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the total size of all messages in octets. This does not include messages marked for deletion.
        Returns:
        the total size in octets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the size cannot be determined

      • getMessageList

        java.util.Iterator<MessageDescriptor> getMessageList()
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an iterator over all message descriptors in the mailbox. Messages are returned in order by message number (1-based). Messages marked for deletion are not included.

        Using an iterator rather than a list allows implementations to lazily load descriptors, reducing memory usage for large mailboxes. Use getMessageCount() to get the total count.

        Returns:
        iterator over message descriptors
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the messages cannot be enumerated

      • getMessage

        MessageDescriptor getMessage​(int messageNumber)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the message descriptor for the specified message number.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        Returns:
        the message descriptor, or null if the message doesn't exist
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the descriptor cannot be retrieved

      • getMessageContent

        java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel getMessageContent​(int messageNumber)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a channel to read the entire message content. The content includes headers and body, with proper RFC 822 formatting.

        The caller is responsible for closing the returned channel.

        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        Returns:
        a readable channel for the message content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message cannot be opened

      • getMessageTop

        java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel getMessageTop​(int messageNumber,
                                                    int bodyLines)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a channel to read the message headers and optionally a portion of the body, as required by the POP3 TOP command (RFC 1939 Section 7).

        The content returned includes:

        1. All message headers (RFC 822 format)
        2. A blank line (CRLF) separating headers from body
        3. The first bodyLines lines of the message body

        The caller is responsible for closing the returned channel.

        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        bodyLines - the number of body lines to retrieve after headers (0 means headers only, with trailing blank line)
        Returns:
        a readable channel for the headers and body lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the content cannot be retrieved

      • getFlags

        default java.util.Set<Flag> getFlags​(int messageNumber)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the flags for the specified message.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        Returns:
        set of flags for the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if flags cannot be retrieved

      • setFlags

        default void setFlags​(int messageNumber,
                      java.util.Set<Flag> flags,
                      boolean add)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Sets flags on the specified message.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        flags - the flags to set
        add - true to add flags, false to remove them
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if flags cannot be modified

                          java.util.Set<Flag> flags)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Replaces all flags on the specified message.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        flags - the new set of flags
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if flags cannot be modified

      • getPermanentFlags

        default java.util.Set<Flag> getPermanentFlags()
        Returns the set of permanent flags supported by this mailbox. Permanent flags are preserved across sessions.
        Returns:
        set of supported permanent flags

      • deleteMessage

        void deleteMessage​(int messageNumber)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Marks a message for deletion. The message is not actually deleted until close() is called with expunge=true, or expunge() is called explicitly.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the message cannot be marked for deletion

      • isDeleted

        boolean isDeleted​(int messageNumber)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if a message is marked for deletion.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        Returns:
        true if the message is marked for deletion
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the status cannot be determined

      • undeleteAll

        void undeleteAll()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Unmarks all messages marked for deletion. This is used by the POP3 RSET command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the messages cannot be unmarked

      • expunge

        default java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> expunge()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Permanently removes all messages marked for deletion. This is the IMAP EXPUNGE command.
        Returns:
        list of expunged message numbers (in ascending order)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if messages cannot be expunged

      • getUniqueId

        java.lang.String getUniqueId​(int messageNumber)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the unique identifier for a message. This must be unique and persistent across sessions. Typically derived from Message-ID or a content hash.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message sequence number (1-based)
        Returns:
        the unique identifier string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the UID cannot be retrieved

      • getUidValidity

        default long getUidValidity()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the UIDVALIDITY value for this mailbox. This value must change if UIDs are reassigned.
        Returns:
        the UIDVALIDITY value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the value cannot be determined

      • getUidNext

        default long getUidNext()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the next UID value that will be assigned.
        Returns:
        the next UID value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the value cannot be determined

      • startAppendMessage

        default void startAppendMessage​(java.util.Set<Flag> flags,
                                java.time.OffsetDateTime internalDate)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Begins appending a new message to this mailbox.

        This is the first of three methods used for streaming message append in an event-driven architecture. After calling this method, call appendMessageContent(ByteBuffer) zero or more times as data arrives, then call endAppendMessage() to complete the operation.

        Only one append operation may be in progress at a time per mailbox instance. Implementations should throw an exception if this method is called while an append is already in progress.

        Parameters:
        flags - initial flags for the message, or null for no flags
        internalDate - the internal date, or null for current time
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the append cannot be started

      • appendMessageContent

        default void appendMessageContent​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Appends content data to the message currently being appended.

        This method may be called multiple times as data arrives from the client. The data should be in RFC 822 format. The buffer should be ready for reading (flipped).

        This method must only be called after startAppendMessage(java.util.Set<org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.Flag>, java.time.OffsetDateTime) and before endAppendMessage().

        Parameters:
        data - buffer containing message content data, ready for reading
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the content cannot be written
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no append is in progress

      • endAppendMessage

        default long endAppendMessage()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Completes the message append operation.

        This method finalizes the append, assigns a UID to the new message, and makes it visible in the mailbox. After this method returns, the server can send the response to the client.

        If an error occurs, implementations should clean up any partial data and throw an exception. The mailbox should remain in a consistent state.

        Returns:
        the UID of the newly appended message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the append cannot be completed
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no append is in progress

      • copyMessages

        default java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Long> copyMessages​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> messageNumbers,
                                                                           java.lang.String destinationMailbox)
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Copies messages to another mailbox.
        Parameters:
        messageNumbers - the message sequence numbers to copy
        destinationMailbox - the destination mailbox name
        Returns:
        mapping of source sequence numbers to destination UIDs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the copy fails

      • moveMessages

        default java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Long> moveMessages​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> messageNumbers,
                                                                           java.lang.String destinationMailbox)
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Moves messages to another mailbox. This is equivalent to COPY followed by marking as deleted.
        Parameters:
        messageNumbers - the message sequence numbers to move
        destinationMailbox - the destination mailbox name
        Returns:
        mapping of source sequence numbers to destination UIDs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the move fails

      • search

        default java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> search​(SearchCriteria criteria)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Searches for messages matching the given criteria.

        The default implementation iterates through all messages, parses each one using MessageParser, and evaluates against the criteria. This is slow for large mailboxes. Implementations may override to use indexed search for better performance.

        Parameters:
        criteria - the search criteria
        Returns:
        list of matching message sequence numbers
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the search fails
        See Also:
        SearchCriteria, MessageContext, ParsedMessageContext
